content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x equals, 2 sine x, plus, cosine x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>sin</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>cos</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The average rate of change of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> over the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma b, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is 0.05, where <math alttext="b is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>b</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is an equation that could be used to find the value of <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="f of b, minus f of 0, equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator f of b, minus f of 0, and denominator b minus 0, end fraction, equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator f of b, plus f of 0, and denominator 2, equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator f of b, minus f of 0, and denominator b minus 0, end fraction, equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
